teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Asia-Pacific Greens Federation
teams.loan_because:
Our core values are social justice, non-violence, respect for diversity, sustainability, participatory democracy and ecological wisdom.  
Read our Global Greens Charter at: http://www.asiapacificgreens.org/charter
teams.description:
The Asia-Pacific Greens Federation (APGF) supports Green Parties, social and environmental movements from grassroots to government across the Asia-Pacific region to be exemplars of nonviolence, sustainability, social justice, participatory democracy, respect for diversity and ecological wisdom. 

The APGF does this by building the capacity of Green parties to win elections, develop Green policies, and to operate according to Green values; facilitating global communication, joint action, networking, mutual support, experience exchange and learning; assisting policy development, research and campaigning; and enabling education about the Greens and green issues.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Kiva Flash Mob
teams.loan_because:
we want to bring lenders from different teams together and show some Kiva love to loans have so far been overlooked. We want to help get them funded by organizing a Flash Mob to these loans.  

The effect of many lenders loaning to the same loan at the same time is that the loan will show up on page 1 of the popularity sort, which is the default page that most lenders look at when they come to Kiva. So besides the loans from the Flash Mob team, Flash Mob loans often attract many additional loans from other lenders who just happened to log into Kiva at this time. Sometimes a loan gets completely funded within the hour!

Feel free to keep attributing your loans to your favorite team, it is fun to see many different team logos on the same loan.
teams.description:
Primary Flash Mob time is 9am US West Coast / noon EST / 6pm MET / 4am AET

If you can't join the primary Flash Mob, a second Flash Mob time is 11pm US West Coast / 2am EST / 8am MET / 6pm AET

The loan will be posted an hour or two in advance to give you time to research it. For maximum Flash Mob impact, please try to loan exactly at Flash Mob time.

For email alerts with just the daily loan link, please join http://www.kiva.org/team/KFM_messages and set your email preferences for that team to immediate delivery. For a comprehensive description of the Flash Mob loan, to talk to other Flash Mobbers and to suggest loans, please join this team. 

Loans selected for the Flash Mob are typically within 2 weeks of expiration (preferably red-boxed) and completely unfunded or lacking a substantial amount. For suggestions please message the captains.

teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

Members of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster  

Secular vs religious Field Partners, see links at http://atheist-monkey.blogspot.de/2009/08/kiva-mfi-checker.html

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: Thank Joss
teams.loan_because: Joss Whedon has made a difference in our lives. We want to thank him by making a difference in somebody else's.
teams.description: We're a passionate group of fans of Joss Whedon and his work. We believe that if nothing we do matters, then all that matters is what we do. (We are fans of Tim Minear, too, naturally.) And what we want to do is make a difference. Our Team Photo was taken by Gage Skidmore and comes from the Wikimedia Commons.

teams.name: Team New England
teams.loan_because: we believe given the opportunity, every individual has within them the ability to make a difference. Our aim is to afford those opportunities to individuals looking to change their lives and in doing so better their community.
teams.description: We are New Englanders, located in the northeast corner of the United States. We hail from towns dotted along the Green Mountains of Vermont and the sandy coastlines of the Bay and Ocean States. The White Mountains and wilderness of (the free state) New Hampshire and the Gold Coast of Connecticut we call our home. The dense forests of Maine lend us the Pine Tree emblem affixed upon our flag proudly uniting the region for hundreds of years and today our cause for empowering people around the world. We welcome anyone who wishes to join us!

teams.name: Asia-Pacific Greens Federation
teams.loan_because:
Our core values are social justice, non-violence, respect for diversity, sustainability, participatory democracy and ecological wisdom.  
Read our Global Greens Charter at: http://www.asiapacificgreens.org/charter
teams.description:
The Asia-Pacific Greens Federation (APGF) supports Green Parties, social and environmental movements from grassroots to government across the Asia-Pacific region to be exemplars of nonviolence, sustainability, social justice, participatory democracy, respect for diversity and ecological wisdom. 

The APGF does this by building the capacity of Green parties to win elections, develop Green policies, and to operate according to Green values; facilitating global communication, joint action, networking, mutual support, experience exchange and learning; assisting policy development, research and campaigning; and enabling education about the Greens and green issues.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Philippines
teams.loan_because: we want the world to become free from poverty. We will make this possible by offering poor people the possibility to move on by themselves and manage to climb out of poverty.

teams.name: NWTF PHILIPPINES
teams.loan_because:
1. NWTF can be TRUSTED (see their financial reports pp. 20-21 at their 2010 ANNUAL REPORT. http://nwtf.ph/reports/annual/AR2010.pdf
2. NWTF has more than 25 years of micro-finance EXPERIENCE.
3. NWTF's clients have shown consistent repayment PERFORMANCE (see p.19 of the 2010 ANNUAL REPORT. http://nwtf.ph/reports/annual/AR2010.pdf
teams.description:
VISIT & EXPLORE : www.nwtf.ph
  NWTF has struck me as an organization that has the well-being of its member clients at the heart of all its activities. It is a pioneer in social performance management, and uses the progress out of poverty index (developed by Grameen) to measure a clients' poverty level following each loan cycle." Joanne, Kiva Fellow (volunteer)

teams.name: Aunt Kim's Birthday Gift by Vietnam Initiative Project of Harvard-Westlake School
teams.whereabouts: Harvard-Westlake School, 3700 Coldwater Canyon Ave  Studio City, CA 91604
teams.loan_because: we want to help those in need. This project is in honor of our Aunt Kim who is battling breast cancer. She is a giving and selfless person, and we are making loans to budding entrepreneurs in extension of that spirit of generosity and charity. Please view and share our Youtube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lm6zI4wANSg
teams.description: Vietnam Initiative Project is a student organization started at Harvard Westlake High School with many members in high schools in Southern California. The student organization is coordinating the fundraising efforts for this project on behalf of the Aunt of one of its members.

teams.name: John Burroughs Team
teams.loan_because: John Burroughs School emphasizes the importance of giving back to others. Loaning to independent businesses in other less affluent countries is our way of helping not only the community but also the rest of the world.
teams.description: The John Burroughs Team loves loaning to striving businesses. We are all very aware of the conditions of other countries and aim to support their entrepreneurial interests.

teams.loan_because: It is part of the philosophy of our company. We want to bring open and free software to the world. Part of that culture is helping others help themselves.
teams.description: The Red Hat team consists of employees only, we work for a company that helps people use free and open source software as effectively as possible. Free and open source software is software that you can get from the internet for no cost, and you have the freedom to look at the source and do with it what you want. This helps people educate themselves, but also creates better software as many people can look at it and find bugs.

teams.name: DoSomething
teams.loan_because: DoSomething.org is the country’s largest not-for-profit for young people and social change. We have 1,666,208 members (and counting) who kick ass on causes they care about. Bullying. Animal cruelty. Homelessness. Cancer. The list goes on. DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.

NEWS! In honor of International Women's Day, if you join our team, then make a loan and credit our team, we'll match your loan with one of our own!!*

We believe in the multiplier effect of supplying capital to women - supporting a woman in opening or growing a business enables her to buy food and housing for her family, send her children to school, and contribute to the welfare of her community.  We want to help put more women on the road to Financial Independence Through Entrepreneurship. Join the FITE!
* We'll match up to 3,000 loans.

teams.name: Happy Kiva Lenders
teams.description:
We Happy Kiva Lenders think Kiva is great and are happy to see Kiva lending to everyone including US citizens.  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
People in need are people in need regardless of where they live.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Our Goal is to show our support for Kiva's decision to fight poverty everywhere!
Please join us Happy Kiva Lenders and showing your support for Kiva by lending to whomever you want! 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

 You can help in 3 ways - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   
1) Join this team! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2) Make a loan!  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
3) Share this page with your friends! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - -  

 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Through our numbers and our loans we'll let Kiva know that they have our support in fighting poverty everywhere!

teams.name: Bo - a celebration
teams.loan_because: Kiva allows those with little income or erratic income to give to those more disadvantage than themselves – and to give generously - by repeatedly re-distributing the original donation each month.
teams.description:
Those who ever met my much much adored 22-year-old Bo, could not fail to perceive a very considerate, kind generous soul. Despite his youth he had already been impressively proactive in helping disadvantaged people. Let’s continue in his vein.

Bo would have liked the idea of a Kiva team in his name, and he would have been touched.

teams.name: Maria Shriver + A Woman's Nation
teams.loan_because: For as little as $25, we can help women entrepreneurs right in our own backyard.
teams.description:
Continuing what she began as First Lady of California, Maria Shriver and A Woman’s Nation are partnering with Kiva, the world's first person-to-person microlending website, to empower thousands of women across America to become more financially independent. Our partnership shows that every loan you make to a woman entrepreneur – even $25 – will make a real difference. 

As "The Shriver Report: A Woman’s Nation Pushes Back from the Brink"* states, 1 in 3 American women lives on or near the brink of poverty. By starting or expanding her own business, a woman can lift herself and her family off the brink. JOIN US in moving women and families forward!

A Woman’s Nation™ is a nonprofit organization founded by Maria Shriver that imagines a new way forward for women and men, girls and boys. Through its multimedia initiatives and innovative partnerships, A Woman's Nation informs, inspires, and implements bold ideas into action with the goal of creating a culture where all lives and all work are respected, recognized, and valued. To learn more please visit AWomansNation.org.
 
* A project of A Woman's Nation, produced in partnership with Center for American Progress.

teams.name: Tollefson Pirates of the Saskatchewan
teams.loan_because: We loan because of wanting to do something about the unequal distribution of wealth and resources in our world.  Loaning to entrepreneurs is an effective way of helping people and developing local economies. We are pleased to be able to do that. Because of Terry Tollefson's interests we suggest loans supporting farming and education, although we welcome all loans.
teams.description: Our team honours the  memory of Professor Terry Tollefson who taught Soil Science in the College of Agriculture and Bioresources at the University of Saskatchewan.  Terry was an excellent teacher, a dear colleague, friend, and dedicated family man.  He was a successful farmer who applied what he taught to conservation farming in the semi-arid  prairies of Saskatchewan.  Many students from Saskatchewan and from distant lands became his good friends, experiencing Terry's consistent support  and interest in their life's journey.

teams.name: Tollefson Pirates of the Saskatchewan
teams.loan_because: We loan because of wanting to do something about the unequal distribution of wealth and resources in our world.  Loaning to entrepreneurs is an effective way of helping people and developing local economies. We are pleased to be able to do that. Because of Terry Tollefson's interests we suggest loans supporting farming and education, although we welcome all loans.
teams.description: Our team honours the  memory of Professor Terry Tollefson who taught Soil Science in the College of Agriculture and Bioresources at the University of Saskatchewan.  Terry was an excellent teacher, a dear colleague, friend, and dedicated family man.  He was a successful farmer who applied what he taught to conservation farming in the semi-arid  prairies of Saskatchewan.  Many students from Saskatchewan and from distant lands became his good friends, experiencing Terry's consistent support  and interest in their life's journey.

teams.name: Ship for World Youth Alumni Association
teams.loan_because: Microlending is a great vehicle to improve the quality of living of people living all over the world.
teams.description:
The Ship for World Youth (SWY) program, operated by Cabinet Office, Government of Japan, is a program that involves youths from Japan and countries around the world. They board the Ship for World Youth, live together, and while on board and when visiting the different countries, they study and discuss common issues from a global perspective and participate in other various activities that involve multi-cultural and multi-national exchange opportunities. 

For our team members, we are generally trying to lend to countries that have already participated on the SWY. Not all of the countries that have been on SWY have microfinance loans on Kiva, so please look for countries that were on your ship using the map on the lend page.

We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Carnegie Mellon University
teams.loan_because: we want to help people help themselves.
teams.description: We associate with Carnegie Mellon University.

teams.name: Kiva Jews
teams.loan_because: Tikkun Olam - making the world a better place.
teams.description: One of Judaism's most famous scholars, Maimonides, said that the highest form of charity is to help someone no longer need charity - and lending to Kiva does that.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. It’s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Team USA
teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Christian Scientists
teams.loan_because:
“Divine Love always has met and always will meet every human need."
- Mary Baker Eddy
teams.description: We believe it is our duty to daily follow the Christ example of lovingly helping the those in need.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.
